_comment: ## Positional parameters (%1$s, %2$s, %3$s, etc.) may be reordered to suit your language's sentence structure
jm.advanced.announcemod.tooltip: Announces in the chat window that JourneyMap is ready.
jm.advanced.automappoll.tooltip: Delay (in milliseconds) between AutoMap region tasks. Lower values will decrease time to AutoMap, but can hurt performance.
jm.advanced.browserpoll.tooltip: Delay (in milliseconds) before the web map requests updates.  Lower values can hurt performance.
jm.advanced.cache_animals.tooltip: Duration (in milliseconds) radar data is cached before checking for new animals. Lower values can hurt performance.
jm.advanced.cache_mobs.tooltip: Duration (in milliseconds) radar data is cached before checking for new mobs. Lower values can hurt performance.
jm.advanced.cache_player.tooltip: Duration (in milliseconds) status data about you is cached before being rechecked. Lower values can hurt performance.
jm.advanced.cache_players.tooltip: Duration (in milliseconds) radar data is cached before checking for new players. Lower values can hurt performance.
jm.advanced.cache_villagers.tooltip: Duration (in milliseconds) radar data is cached before checking for new villagers. Lower values can hurt performance.
jm.advanced.checkupdates.tooltip: Turning this off means you won't be notified when there's a new version of JourneyMap available.
jm.advanced.loglevel.tooltip: Caution! Some logging levels will hurt performance. Keep the default unless otherwise instructed.
jm.advanced.port.tooltip: The default port used to display the web map in your browser, enter a value between 80 and 10000. If the port is already in use, JourneyMap will try to find an open one by increments of 10.
jm.advanced.recordcachestats.tooltip: Whether to enable caches to record their statistics. May slightly hurt performance if enabled. Unless you're a beta-tester or have been instructed to do so, leave it off.
jm.advanced.tile_render_type.tooltip: Optimize map tile rendering for your video card if they become blurry. Values adjust texture filter + wrap type: 1=Linear+Mirrored, 2=Linear+Clamped, 3=Nearest+Mirrored, 4=Nearest+Clamped.
jm.colorpalette.file_error: The color palette file has errors and cannot be used: %1$s
jm.colorpalette.file_header_1: This file can be used to keep map colors consistent when changing resource packs.
jm.colorpalette.file_header_2: Edit at your own risk. You can view it using the %1$s file.
jm.colorpalette.file_header_3: To use this palette with a single world, place %1$s in: %2$s
jm.colorpalette.file_header_4: To use this palette with all worlds, edit and set "permanent": true, then place %1$s in: %2$s
jm.colorpalette.file_missing_data: Put this file in the same directory as %1$s to view the color palette.
jm.common.alwaysmapcaves.tooltip: Always map the caves in your vertical chunk, even when on the Overworld surface. Disabling this will improve performance.
jm.common.alwaysmapsurface.tooltip: Always map the Overworld surface, even when underground. Disabling this will improve performance.
jm.common.automap_complete_underground: Auto-mapping of vertical chunk %1$s has stopped.
jm.common.automap_dialog_summary_1: Note: Disable these Cartography options for faster results:
jm.common.automap_dialog_text: Automatically map all regions or just missing regions?
jm.common.colorreset_text: Re-calculate the map colors for all blocks
jm.common.deletemap_dialog_text: Delete map in all dimensions or just this dimension?
jm.common.deletemap_status_error: Unable to delete map. See journeymap.log for details.
jm.common.deletemap_text: Delete map in one or more dimensions
jm.common.waypoint.create_packet: §eJourneymap:§f waypoint %s created by server at [%d, %d, %d] in %s
jm.common.discord.tooltip: Join our community for discussion or help.
jm.common.download.tooltip: Get the latest betas and releases on Curseforge.com
jm.common.file_updates: Files are being updated (%1$s). Mapping suspended.
jm.common.font_scale.tooltip: The font scale for labels and text
jm.common.grid_edit.tooltip: Change the appearance of the chunk grid on all maps
jm.common.hotkeys.tooltip: View the Hot Keys which can be used with this map
jm.common.location_format.tooltip: Format of how location coordinates are displayed. Note: 'v' stands for vertical chunk.
jm.common.location_format_verbose.toolti: Location shows coordinate names (x,y,z) with the numbers
jm.common.log_warning: Log level %1$s will slow down the game. Do not use for normal gameplay!
jm.common.map_style_antialiasing.tooltip: Enhances the shading effect used to show elevation changes. Disabling may improve performance.
jm.common.map_style_bathymetry.tooltip: Shows the terrain of the ocean floor and under water
jm.common.map_style_blendgrass.tooltip: Blends grass colors between biomes. Disable to improve performance.
jm.common.map_style_blendfoliage.tooltip: Blends foliage colors between biomes. Disable to improve performance.
jm.common.map_style_blendwater.tooltip: Blends water colors between biomes. Disable to improve performance.
jm.common.map_style_topography.tooltip: Provides a contour map that shows elevation changes
jm.common.map_style_caveignoreglass.tool: Being under a glass roof will not switch to cave mapping
jm.common.map_style_cavelighting.tooltip: Use the actual light levels underground. Disable to use full light.
jm.common.map_style_caveshowsurface.tool: A dim view of the nearby surface is visible when underground
jm.common.map_style_crops.tooltip: Crops are shown on the map
jm.common.map_style_plants.tooltip: Plants are shown on the map
jm.common.map_style_plantshadows.tooltip: Plants and crops will cast shadows on the map
jm.common.map_style_transparency.tooltip: Transparent blocks will reveal what is below them
jm.common.memory_warning: Minecraft is running out of memory: %1$s
jm.common.mob_icon_set.tooltip: The iconset used to display mobs on radar
jm.common.patreon.tooltip: Like JourneyMap? Become a patron and support development!
jm.common.radar_hide_sneaking.tooltip: Whether to hide creatures that are trying to sneak (crouch). Changing this setting is harmless.
jm.common.radar_lateral_distance.tooltip: Lateral distance (in blocks) to search for and display entities on Radar. Larger numbers may cause significant lag.
jm.common.radar_max_animals.tooltip: The maximum number of passive mobs displayed on Radar. Larger numbers may cause lag.
jm.common.radar_max_mobs.tooltip: The maximum number of hostile mobs displayed on Radar. Larger numbers may cause lag.
jm.common.radar_max_players.tooltip: The maximum number of players displayed on Radar. Larger numbers may cause lag.
jm.common.radar_max_villagers.tooltip: The maximum number of villagers displayed on Radar. Larger numbers may cause lag.
jm.common.radar_vertical_distance.toolti: Vertical distance (in blocks) to search for and display entities on Radar. Larger numbers may cause significant lag.
jm.common.renderdelay.tooltip: Time (in seconds) between Render Passes. Higher values can improve performance, but may result in missed chunks while travelling.
jm.common.renderdistance_cave_max.toolti:
Radius of chunks around you that are eventually mapped underground or in dimensions with no sky. Lower values can improve performance. Values geater than Minecraft's Render Distance have no effect.
Set to 0 to mirror video option chunk render range.
jm.common.renderdistance_cave_min.toolti:
Radius of chunks around you that are always mapped when underground or in dimensions with no sky. Lower values can improve performance. Values geater than Minecraft's Render Distance have no effect.
Set to 0 to mirror video option chunk render range.
jm.common.renderdistance_surface_max.too:
Radius of chunks around you that are eventually mapped on the surface in dimensions with a sky. Lower values can improve performance. Values geater than Minecraft's Render Distance have no effect.
Set to 0 to mirror video option chunk render range.
jm.common.renderdistance_surface_min.too:
Radius of chunks around you that are always mapped on the surface in dimensions with a sky. Lower values can improve performance. Values geater than Minecraft's Render Distance have no effect.
Set to 0 to mirror video option chunk render range.
jm.common.renderstats.title: Statistics from the latest Render Pass
jm.common.renderstats.tooltip: Total chunks = (All chunks in Min Distance + Some chunks of Max Distance). The world terrain around you and the Cartography options you select will change these numbers significantly.
jm.common.revealshape.tooltip: Shape of the map area revealed around you. Circle reveals fewer chunks than Square and will improve performance.
jm.common.show_animals.tooltip: Nearby passive mobs are shown on the map
jm.common.show_caves.tooltip: Switch to Cave map when underground or indoors
jm.common.show_day_night.tooltip: Switch to Day or Night map automatically
jm.common.show_entity_names.tooltip: Show names of pets, NPCs, etc. on the map
jm.common.show_grid.tooltip: Show a grid of chunk boundaries on the map
jm.common.show_mobs.tooltip: Nearby hostile mobs are shown on the map
jm.common.show_pets.tooltip: Nearby pets are shown on the map
jm.common.show_players.tooltip: Nearby players are shown on the map
jm.common.show_self.tooltip: Your locator icon is shown on the map
jm.common.show_villagers.tooltip: Nearby villagers are shown on the map
jm.common.show_waypoints.tooltip: Nearby waypoints are shown on the map
jm.common.tile_display_quality.tooltip: Recommended for use with "My Heading" Minimap rotation. Uncheck to improve zoom performance and memory usage. Only affects how a map tile displays, not how it is saved.
jm.common.ui_theme.tooltip: The Theme used to display UI controls in the Fullscreen Map and to style the MiniMap
jm.common.ui_theme_applied: UI Theme applied. Go to §bOptions > MiniMap Preset #§f to customize the MiniMap appearance.
jm.common.webserver_and_mapgui_disabled: JourneyMap is disabled by jm.common.properties file
jm.common.webserver_and_mapgui_ready: Press [§b%1$s§f] or open browser to§b§n http://localhost%2$s §f
jm.common.webserver_only_ready: Open browser to§b§n http://localhost%1$s §f. (In-game map disabled)
jm.common.website: Help and How-To articles on using JourneyMap
jm.common.time_format.tooltip: "Time format for the InfoSlot:Real Game Time"
jm.config.category.advanced.tooltip: Caution! Changing some of these values can cause significant problems and/or crashes.
jm.config.category.cartography.tooltip: Configure how map images are created
jm.config.category.fullmap.tooltip: Configure the appearance of the Fullscreen Map
jm.config.category.minimap.tooltip: Configure the appearance of MiniMap Preset 1. (Switch between presets in-game using the '\' key)
jm.config.category.minimap2.tooltip: Configure the appearance of MiniMap Preset 2. (Switch between presets in-game using the '\' key)
jm.config.category.waypoint.tooltip: Configure how waypoints are managed and displayed on maps
jm.config.category.waypoint_beacons.tool: Configure how waypoint beacons are displayed in-game
jm.config.category.webmap.tooltip: Configure the appearance of the Web Map
jm.config.control_arrowkeys: This value can be adjusted with arrow keys for finer control
jm.config.file_header_1: JourneyMap configuration file. Modify at your own risk!
jm.config.file_header_2: To use in all worlds, place here: %1$s
jm.config.file_header_3: To override configuration for a single world, place here: %1$s(world name)
jm.config.file_header_4: To restore the default settings, simply delete this file before starting Minecraft
jm.config.reset.tooltip: Reset all options in this section back to their default values
jm.error.compatability: Incompatability error running %1$s for Forge %2$s. Ensure your version of Forge is compatible.
jm.error.java6: JourneyMap requires Java 7 or Java 8. Update your launcher profile to use a newer version of Java.
jm.fullscreen.title: Full-screen Map
jm.minimap.compass_font_scale.tooltip: The font scale used for compass point labels
jm.minimap.frame_alpha.tooltip: Adjust how opaque the MiniMap frame is (as a percentage)
jm.minimap.hotkeys.tooltip: Enable in-game hotkeys to control the MiniMap
jm.minimap.mob_display.tooltip: Show mobs as icons or colored dots.
jm.minimap.mob_heading.tooltip: Show which direction mobs are looking
jm.minimap.orientation.button.tooltip: The orientation (rotation) of the MiniMap. Note: Only Circle supports the "My Heading" Map Heading.
jm.minimap.player_display.tooltip: Show players as icons or colored dots.
jm.minimap.player_heading.tooltip: Show which direction other players are looking
jm.minimap.position.tooltip: Change the position of the MiniMap on your screen
jm.minimap.preview.tooltip: Preview this Minimap Preset with the current settings. Switch to preview the other Preset using the '\' key. Deselect (or press ESC) to stop the preview.
jm.minimap.reticle_orientation.tooltip: The orientation (rotation) of the reticle on the MiniMap
jm.minimap.shape.tooltip: The shape of the MiniMap. Note: Only Circle supports the "My Heading" Map Heading.
jm.minimap.show_biome.tooltip: Show the biome of your location
jm.minimap.show_compass.tooltip: Show compass points on the MiniMap frame
jm.minimap.show_fps.tooltip: Show the current Frames Per Second (FPS)
jm.minimap.show_reticle.tooltip: Show a reticle (crosshairs) on the MiniMap
jm.minimap.show_waypointlabels.tooltip: Show waypoint labels on the map
jm.minimap.size.tooltip: Adjust the size of the MiniMap (as percent of window size). Sizes over 768px may hurt performance.
jm.minimap.terrain_alpha.tooltip: Adjust how opaque the map is (as a percentage)
jm.minimap.texture_size.tooltip: Use small icons on the map
jm.minimap.title: Mini Map
jm.theme.labelsource.biome.tooltip: Show the biome of your location
jm.theme.labelsource.gametime.tooltip: Show the world time (20 minute cycle)
jm.waypoint.auto_hide_label.tooltip: Hide waypoint labels when you're not looking toward them
jm.waypoint.bold_label.tooltip: Use bold waypoint labels on beacons
jm.waypoint.create_deathpoints.tooltip: Automatically create a waypoint at the spot where you die
jm.waypoint.teleport_command.tooltip: Set the teleport command for your server. Create the custom command for your server with these keys. Player Name:{name} - Waypoint Coordinates:{x} {y} {z} - Target Dimension:{dim}.
jm.waypoint.auto_remove_deathpoints.tool: Automatically removes death waypoints as you approach them
jm.waypoint.auto_deathpoint_remove_dista: The distance which the death waypoint is removed, minimum 2 or it will get removed when created.
jm.waypoint.show_death_point_label_on_ma: Display Death Waypoint Label on map overlay.
Disables death waypoint the label on the fullscreen and minimap.
jm.waypoint.double_click_create.tooltip: Double clicking on the fullscreen map will create a waypoint at location.
jm.waypoint.enable_beacons.tooltip: Show in-game beacons of your waypoints
jm.waypoint.enable_manager.tooltip: Enable the Waypoint Manager. If you use another mod to manage waypoints, you should disable this.
jm.waypoint.font_scale.tooltip: The font scale used to display waypoint labels in-game.
jm.waypoint.help_import_rei: Or copy §b%1$s§f to §b%2$s§f and restart Minecraft.
jm.waypoint.help_import_voxel: Or copy §b%1$s§f to §b%2$s§f and restart Minecraft.
jm.waypoint.import_rei_errors: Imported %1$s waypoints from Rei's MiniMap with %2$s errors. See log for details.
jm.waypoint.import_rei_failure: No Rei's MiniMap waypoints were imported. See journeymap.log for details.
jm.waypoint.import_rei_file_error: Could not import Rei's MiniMap waypoint file: %1$s
jm.waypoint.import_rei_success: Imported %1$s waypoints from of Rei's Minimap.
jm.waypoint.import_rei_version: Your version of Rei's MiniMap is not supported.
jm.waypoint.import_vox_errors: Imported %1$s waypoints from VoxelMap with %2$s errors. See log for details.
jm.waypoint.import_vox_failure: No VoxelMap waypoints were imported. See journeymap.log for details.
jm.waypoint.import_vox_file_error: Could not import VoxelMap waypoint file: %1$s
jm.waypoint.import_vox_version: Your version of VoxelMap is not supported. Please update to:
jm.waypoint.max_distance.tooltip: The maximum distance from you (in blocks/meters) that a waypoint should be displayed. Affects both waypoints on maps and waypoint beacons. Set to 0 for no maximum.
jm.waypoint.min_distance.tooltip: The minimum distance from you (in blocks/meters) that a waypoint beacon should be displayed. Set to 0 for no minimum.
jm.waypoint.name: Name
jm.waypoint.show_distance.tooltip: Show the distance (in blocks/meters) to the waypoint in its label
jm.waypoint.show_name.tooltip: Show the name of the waypoint in its label
jm.waypoint.show_rotating_beam.tooltip: Use a rotating outer beam for the waypoint beacons
jm.waypoint.show_static_beam.tooltip: Use a stationary inner beam for the waypoint beacons
jm.waypoint.show_texture.tooltip: Show the icon of a waypoint with its beacon
jm.waypoint.texture_size.tooltip: Use a small icon for the waypoint beacons
jm.webmap.automap_complete_underground: Auto-mapping of vertical chunk %1$s has stopped.
jm.webmap.automap_dialog_text: Automatically map all regions or just missing regions?
jm.webmap.automap_started: Auto-mapping started. Check game chat for progress.
jm.webmap.caves_menu_item_title: Show cave/interior map when you are not under sky.
jm.webmap.day_button_title: The world map as it appears in daylight.
jm.webmap.donate_title: Donate to JourneyMap development using Patreon
jm.webmap.email_sub_title: Subscribe to JourneyMap news by Email
jm.webmap.enable.tooltip: Enable the web map (starts an embedded web server)
jm.webmap.follow_button_title: Auto-center the map on you. (Turns off if you manually pan.)
jm.webmap.google_domain.tooltip: If your country blocks maps.google.com, select a different domain for the Google Maps API.
jm.webmap.night_button_title: The world map as it appears in moonlight.
jm.webmap.rss_feed_title: Subscribe to JourneyMap news by RSS feed
jm.webmap.save_button_title: Save the explored map to file
jm.webmap.title: Web Map
jm.webmap.topo_button_title: A topographical map of the world
jm.server.edit.label.selection.global.to: These are the default properties for the server. Enable individual dimension properties to override the global properties.
jm.server.edit.label.selection.default.t: The settings here will be the default for any new dimensions created.
jm.server.edit.label.selection.dimension: If enabled these properties will override the global properties.
jm.server.edit.label.worldId.singleplaye: You are in single player mode. Some options may not function or exist. Any option set to §a[Ops]§f will effectively disable it in single player mode.
jm.server.edit.label.worldId.tooltip: This is the unique identifier so player's map data does not overwrite if you are using a multi-world setup or if the user does not give their servers a unique name.
jm.server.edit.chkbox.enable.tooltip: [Enable/Disable]: Enabling this dimension will override the global properties for this dimension.
jm.server.edit.chkbox.teleport.tooltip:
[Enable/Disable]: Allows or prevents teleport teleporting via waypoint manager.
[Enable/Disable]: If [disabled] will prevent teleporting to, from, and within this dimension.
If [enabled] will allow teleporting within this dimension and to dimensions with teleport [enabled].
jm.server.edit.chkbox.teleport.dimension: §1[Enable/Disable]§f: If §a[disabled]§f will prevent teleporting to, from, and within this dimension.
If §a[enabled]§f will allow teleporting within this dimension and to dimensions with teleport §a[enabled]§f.
jm.server.edit.chkbox.world.id.tooltip:
[Enable/Disable]: Enabling will change the save directory for this servers mapping data.
The primary use is to prevent maps and settings from being over-written when using a multi-world setup and when users do not give servers unique names.
WARNING: If [disabled] and then [enabling] on an active server will reset all user mapping data.
jm.server.edit.chkbox.world.id.tooltip2: The primary use is to prevent maps and settings from being over-written when using a multi-world setup and when users do not give servers unique names.
jm.server.edit.chkbox.world.id.tooltip3: §4WARNING§f: If §c[disabled]§f and then §9[enabling]§f on an active server will reset all user mapping data.
jm.server.edit.slider.update.tooltip: How often the server will send player location updates.
jm.server.edit.toggle.base.op: [Op]: Only Ops/Admins can use this feature.
jm.server.edit.toggle.base.none: [None]: No-One can use this feature it is [disabled].
jm.server.edit.tracking.label: Expanded Radar
jm.server.edit.tracking.tooltip1: If §a[player radar]§f is §a[enabled]§f this feature allows the server to track players outside of the range of the client.
jm.server.edit.tracking.tooltip2: Players can see each other on the map no matter the distance as long as they are in the same dimension.
jm.server.edit.tracking.tooltip3: If this is §a[enabled]§f and player radar is §c[disabled]§f this feature will not work.
jm.server.edit.tracking.tooltip4: If this is §c[disabled]§f and player radar is §a[enabled]§f this feature will not work, but proximity radar will still work.
jm.server.edit.tracking.update.label: Update Time
jm.server.edit.radar.label: Radar Options
jm.server.edit.radar.label.tooltip: Here is where you can fine tune the radar options for users on the server.
jm.server.edit.radar.chkbox.player.toolt: [Enable/Disable]: If players can see other players on the map.
jm.server.edit.radar.chkbox.villager.too: [Enable/Disable]: If players can see villagers on the map.
jm.server.edit.radar.chkbox.animal.toolt: [Enable/Disable]: If players can see animals on the map.
jm.server.edit.radar.chkbox.mob.tooltip: [Enable/Disable]: If players can see monsters or hostile entities on the map.
jm.server.edit.radar.toggle.label: Radar
jm.server.edit.radar.toggle.tooltip1: If set to §a[All]§f it will allow you to fine tune radar options for non §bop§f users.
jm.server.edit.radar.toggle.tooltip2: If set to §a[Ops]§f or §a[All]§f -> Ops will have all radar features enabled.
jm.server.edit.mapping.label: Mapping Options
jm.server.edit.mapping.label.tooltip: Here is where you can fine tune the mapping options for users on the server.
jm.server.edit.mapping.toggle.surface.to: Surface Mapping for All, Ops, None
jm.server.edit.mapping.toggle.topo.label: Topography
jm.server.edit.mapping.toggle.topo.toolt: Topography Mapping for All, Ops, None.
jm.server.edit.mapping.toggle.cave.label: Cave
jm.server.edit.mapping.toggle.cave.toolt: Cave Mapping  for All, Ops, None.
jm.common.radar_hide_spectators.tooltip: Whether to hide spectators on the radar.
jm.common.show_player_loc.tooltip: Show player location below top buttons.
jm.common.show_mouse_loc.tooltip: Show mouse block location above button buttons
jm.minimap.mob_display_scale.tooltip: The scale for Mob icons and dots.
jm.minimap.player_display_scale.tooltip: The scale for Player icons and dots.
jm.minimap.position_x.tooltip: Percentage based value for custom minimap x coordinate location.
jm.minimap.position_y.tooltip: Percentage based value for custom minimap y coordinate location.
jm.minimap.terrain_background_alpha.tool: Adjust how opaque the map background is (as a percentage)
jm.minimap.waypointlabel_scale.tooltip: The font scale for waypoint labels
jm.waypoint.show_deviation.tooltip: Shows the vector deviation between player and waypoint.
jm.waypoint.manager.focus_dim: Waypoint Manager Open in Current Dimension
jm.waypoint.manager.focus_dim.tooltip: Opens the waypoint manager in the current dimension
jm.server.edit.tracking.tooltip:
If [player radar] is [enabled] this feature allows the server to track players outside of the range of the client.
Players can see each other on the map no matter the distance as long as they are in the same dimension.
If this is [enabled] and player radar is [disabled] this feature will not work.
If this is [disabled] and player radar is [enabled] this feature will not work, but proximity radar will still work.
jm.server.edit.radar.tooltip:
All: Radar works for everyone, use individual check boxes to disable specific.
Op: Fully disables radar for everyone but OP users, check boxes work for Ops.
None: Radar is disabled for everyone.
Lets the user mouse over anywhere on the fullscreen to view biomes, works like single-player.
jm.server.edit.hide_ops.tooltip: Hide Ops on radar when Expanded Radar is enabled.
jm.server.radar_hide_spectators.tooltip: Whether to hide spectators on the radar.
jm.server.allow_death_points.tooltip: Whether to allow Death Waypoints to be created on user death.
jm.server.button.no_server.tooltip: Journeymap is not installed on server!
jm.server.allow_in_game_beacons.tooltip: Whether to allow rendering of In-Game beacons to render. (does not disable map waypoints)
jm.server.allow_waypoints.tooltip: Whether to allow waypoints, fully disables map and in-game beacon rendering and associated screens.
jm.server.allow_view_server_prop.tooltip: Whether non op users can view server admin screen in read-only mode.
jm.server.allow_journeymap.tooltip: Whether to allow journeymap to function for non-ops.
jm.common.map_style_biomewatercolor.tool: Shows water colors based on biome.
jm.common.minimap_options.title: Minimap Position: Drag with Mouse or Arrow Keys to move selected item.
jm.common.minimap_position.button.toolti: Click to EditMinimap and Effect Icon Locations
jm.config.category.minimap_position.tool: Configure how the Minimap and Effects are located and rendered.
jm.hud.minimap.key_movement_speed.toolti: When moving the minimap with arrow keys, this option controls how may pixels per key press to help fine tune the location.
jm.hud.effects.anchor.tooltip: Anchors the effect icons to the minimap.
jm.hud.effects.style.vertical.tooltip: Vertical Rendering of the icons first from top to bottom.
jm.hud.effects.style.reverse.tooltip: Reversed Rendering of Icons. Vertical bottom to top, non Vertical let to right
jm.hud.effects.enable.tooltip: Enables moving the potion effects away from the minimap.
jm.minimap.info_slot.background_alpha.to: Adjust the opacity of the Info Slot background.
jm.theme.labelsource.gametime.real.toolt: Shows game time as if sunrise was 6am and not midnight.
jm.server.edit.mapping.toggle.biome.tool: Biome Mapping for All, Ops, None.
jm.server.see_underground_players.toolti:
Expanded Radar Only!
Whether underground players are visible on the radar.
Nether is unaffected by this setting.
ALL: Everyone can see underground players
OP: Only Ops can see underground players
NONE: No one can see underground players.
jm.server.render_range.tooltip:
Force all players to a maximum chunk render distance for the map. 0 to use client settings.
This setting only forces the max, it does not increase their render range.
This value will not be reflected in the client's Cartography section of the Options screen.
jm.advanced.chunk_caching.tooltip: Enables or disables chunk caching, when disabled teleporting or creating waypoints outside of your render range will default to minecraft sealevel y=64.
jm.advanced.gl_error_check.tooltip: Enables GL Error checking, enabling can decrease performance, restart required after changing this value.
jm.options.multiplayer.title: Multiplayer Options
jm.options.multiplayer.category.radar.to: Control how others see you on the map. Note, these options only work when expanded radar is enabled.
jm.options.multiplayer.radar.visible.too: Uncheck to hide yourself from being seen on the map, Ops can still see you.
jm.options.multiplayer.radar.hide_self_u: Disable others from seeing you when you're underground.
jm.common.fullscreen_drag_scale.tooltip: Custom drag scale, higher number slows it down. This is useful when your OS does display scaling, primarily OSX retina displays.
jm.server.multiplayer_settings.tooltip: Whether to allow All players, Op players, or No players to use the multiplayer settings menu.
jm.waypoint.temp_waypoint_remove_distanc: The distance from player when temporary waypoints are auto removed.
jm.waypoint.manager.disable_strikethroug: Disables the strike through of the waypoint text.
